content: The RMI Registry can either be started within the server JVM, via the LocateRegistry.createRegistry() API, or a separate process called rmiregistry that has to be started before remote objects can be added to it, e.g. by the command line in Unix:
stemmed: the rmi registri either start within server jvm , via locateregistry.createregistri ( ) api , separ process call rmiregistri start remot object ad , e.g . command line unix :
